overview:
Nora is the founder and CEO of Clarimed, a startup focused on bringing transparency and openness to the presently opaque healthcare and especially the medical device industry by providing fact-based insights into product quality and performance to help patients, providers, payors, manufacturers and others make informed decisions

Nora also founded Zoragen Inc., a molecular diagnostics startup targeting prenatal screening and cancer diagnostics, which was later licensed then sold to a UK diagnostics company. She worked as a healthcare management consultant for 5 years for McKinsey &Co and as a Sr. Director for Philips Healthcare for 1 year on secondment. She holds a PhD in Bioengineering from MIT, an MPhil in Bioscience Entrepreneurship from the University of Cambridge, UK, and both an MEng and a BS in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science from MIT.
